Interface Critter

public interface Critter

Interface Critter specifies an individual citter's sensory information and performable actions.

Field Summary
static int ALLY
          A constant representing a cell containing an allied critter.
static int BAD
          A constant representing an invalid bearing or cell content.
static int EMPTY
          A constant representing an empty cell.
static int ENEMY
          A constant representing a cell containing an enemy critter.
static int FRONT
          A constant representing a bearing of 0 degrees.
static int FRONT_LEFT
          A constant representing a bearing of 315 degrees clockwise.
static int FRONT_RIGHT
          A constant representing a bearing of 45 degrees.
static int LEFT
          A constant representing a bearing of 270 degrees.
static int REAR
          A constant representing a bearing of 180 degrees.
static int REAR_LEFT
          A constant representing a bearing of 225 degrees.
static int REAR_RIGHT
          A constant representing a bearing of 135 degrees.
static int REGISTERS
          The number of integer registers available to each critter.
static int RIGHT
          A constant representing a bearing of 90 degrees.
static int WALL
          A constant representing a cell containing a wall.

Method Detail

getCode

java.util.List getCode()
Returns a List containing behavior code for this critter, based on this critter's species.

Returns:
a List containing behavior code.

getNextCodeLine

int getNextCodeLine()
Returns the behavior code line number where execution of this critter's behavior code should commence.

Returns:
an integer line number, previously set by setNextCodeLine, or 1 if no previous call to setNextCodeLine has been made.

setNextCodeLine

void setNextCodeLine(int n)
Sets the behavior code line number where execution of this critter's behavior code should continue in the future.

Parameters:
n - an integer line number, >= 1

getReg

int getReg(int n)
Returns the value of one of this critter's registers.

Parameters:
n - the register number, 1 <= n <= REGISTERS
Returns:
the integer value of the specified register, or 0 if the register has not previously been set via setReg.

setReg

void setReg(int n,
            int value)
Stores a value in one of this critter's registers.

Parameters:
n - the register number, 1 <= n <= REGISTERS
value - the value to store

hop

void hop()
Signals that this critter's next action should be to move forward one space.

left

void left()
Signals that this critter's next action should be to change orientation by turning left, 45 degrees counter-clockwise.

right

void right()
Signals that this critter's next action should be to change orientation by turning right, 45 degrees clockwise.

eat

void eat()
Signals that this critter's next action should be to eat any critter in front of it.

infect

void infect()
Signals that this critter's next action should be to infect any critter in front of it. A successfully infected critter will next begin executing its behavior code at the first line.

infect

void infect(int n)
Signals that this critter's next action should be to infect any critter in front of it. A successfully infected critter will next begin executing its behavior code at the specified line.

Parameters:
n - a behavior code line number

getCellContent

int getCellContent(int bearing)
Returns a description of the contents of a cell adjacent to this critter.

Parameters:
bearing - a bearing relative to this critter's heading, one of FRONT, FRONT_LEFT, FRONT_RIGHT, RIGHT, LEFT, REAR, REAR_LEFT, or REAR_RIGHT
Returns:
one of EMPTY, WALL, ENEMY, ALLY, or BAD, if the bearing is invalid.

getOffAngle

int getOffAngle(int bearing)
Returns the off-angle (relative heading) between this critter and an adjacent critter.

Parameters:
bearing - the Bearing of an adjacent critter
Returns:
a Bearing representing the difference in heading between this critter and an adjacent critter, or BAD of no critter is present in the specified adjacent cell.

ifRandom

boolean ifRandom()
Returns a random boolean.

Returns:
true or false with equal probability.
